title: 'Tried to aggressively push our farm interests in US trade deal': Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce minister Piyush Goyal highlighted the nation's strong stance in the US trade deal. The focus was on boosting farm exports and safeguarding sensitive sectors like dairy. The agreement opens new avenues for Indian products such as tea and coffee. Concerns about feed ingredient imports are addressed with a limited quota.

title: Delhi pit death case: Labourer who 1st spotted biker arrested for not informing authorities
content: A labourer, Yogesh, has been arrested for allegedly failing to report a biker's fall into a deep pipeline pit in Janakpuri. The injured biker, Kamal Dhyani, remained trapped for eight hours before authorities were alerted. The sub-contractor, Rajesh Kumar Prajapati, also arrested, reportedly saw Dhyani but left without informing anyone.

title: Triple suicide? 3 found dead in car parked near west Delhi flyover; 'poisonous' smell detected in vehicle
content: Three individuals, including an elderly man and a woman, were discovered deceased inside a car near Delhi's Peeragarhi flyover. Police are investigating the circumstances, exploring possibilities of triple suicide or homicide. A strong odor of a poisonous substance was detected, and a soft drink bottle has been sent for forensic analysis to ascertain the cause of death.

title: In 'clear message', Malaysia, India slam cross-border terror
content: Malaysia joined India in condemning cross-border terrorism, signaling a stronger alignment on the issue. Prime Minister Modi highlighted clear messages against terror with no double standards or compromise. The bilateral meeting saw numerous agreements signed, spanning defense, security, and economic cooperation, including semiconductors and social security for Indian workers.

title: Watch: Team India visits Gambhir’s residence for dinner amid T20 WC campaign
content: Gautam Gambhir hosted a special dinner for the Indian cricket team at his New Delhi residence ahead of their T20 World Cup match against Namibia on February 12, with BCCI vice-president Rajiv Shukla also attending. India began their campaign with a 29-run win over the USA, scoring 161/9 thanks to Suryakumar Yadav’s unbeaten 84. The USA were restricted to 132/8 by Indian bowlers

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
content: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." The workers seek transparency on contracts, an immediate Q&A session, and assurances of safety for all employees, particularly those in vulnerable roles.

title: India, Canada step up security cooperation
content: National Security Advisor Ajit Doval's visit to Canada has yielded a "shared workplan" for bilateral cooperation on national security and law enforcement. Both nations agreed to establish liaison officers to enhance communication and information sharing on critical issues like drug trafficking and organized crime. This move aims to rebuild trust and pave the way for future high-level engagements.

title: NEET-PG cut-off: Single-digit scores land PG seats in top med colleges
content: NEET-PG qualifying standards were drastically lowered, resulting in postgraduate medical seats in government colleges being filled with extremely low scores. Candidates secured spots in high-risk clinical specialties and premier institutions with scores as low as single digits, raising significant concerns within the medical community.

title: 'Will step down when RSS asks me to': Mohan Bhagwat on retirement after age of 75
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat will continue in his role beyond 75 years, as directed by the organization, stating retirement from work is not an option. He emphasized that the RSS chief must be a Hindu, chosen based on merit, not caste. The Sangh focuses on instilling values rather than campaigning, and supports anti-corruption efforts.

title: YouTube TV is reportedly giving $20 monthly discount to select users for four months
content: Select YouTube TV users are reportedly receiving a four-month, $20 monthly discount, totaling $80 off, with eligibility appearing random. Users can check their subscription settings on a desktop browser for the offer. This follows previous credits issued during content blackouts, such as a $15 credit in 2022 and a $20 credit last year due to disputes with Disney.

title: 'They are very cordial': BCCI secretary breaks silence on Gambhir–Kohli rift rumours
content: BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia has dismissed rumors of any tension between head coach Gautam Gambhir and star batter Virat Kohli, describing their relationship as cordial.  Despite past IPL run-ins and speculation surrounding Kohli's career phases, Saikia stated he's never witnessed them fighting. Their successful partnership in India's 2025 Champions Trophy win further underscores unity.

title: Super Bowl LX weather forecast: temps, winds and storm chances in Santa Clara
content: Santa Clara is gearing up for Super Bowl LX with promising weather forecasts. Early indications suggest mild temperatures, light winds, and a low chance of rain for game day, offering favorable conditions for fans and festivities. While February weather can be unpredictable, current models point towards a stable pattern, though forecasters are monitoring potential Pacific storm systems.

title: ‘Border 2’ box office update: Sunny Deol film crosses Rs 309 crore
content: In a remarkable turn of events, Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' has shattered expectations by crossing the coveted Rs 300 crore milestone in India, amassing a staggering Rs 309.4 crore by its third Sunday. After a lukewarm opening, the film caught fire on Republic Day, captivating audiences across the nation. With a total worldwide collection of Rs 422.

title: Claude 'changes' its 'home page' to make fun of Sam Altman's ChatGPT
content: Anthropic's AI assistant Claude now prominently features 'ad-free chats' on its welcome page. This move follows recent advertisements from Anthropic that humorously pointed out the intrusion of ads within AI conversations. The company emphasizes its commitment to providing a helpful and uninterrupted user experience. This latest development continues Anthropic's public campaign to differentiate itself from competitors like OpenAI.

title: Happy Chocolate Day messages, greetings and quotes for 2026
content: Valentine's Week is underway, with February 9th marking Chocolate Day. This sweet tradition encourages couples to express affection through delightful treats, symbolizing various aspects of love. The article offers a collection of messages, wishes, and quotes to help you convey your feelings, making this day extra special for your loved ones.

title: James Pearce Jr & Rickea Jackson dating? What we know amid Falcons rookie’s legal drama
content: Atlanta Falcons rookie James Pearce Jr. was arrested in Miami following a domestic altercation with WNBA player Rickea Jackson. Police pursued Pearce after he allegedly fled the scene, leading to a car crash. He faces serious charges including aggravated battery with a deadly weapon and aggravated stalking. The Falcons are gathering information.

title: Isro study shows safe patch near Moon’s Mons Mouton for Chandrayaan-4 landing
content: ISRO scientists have identified a promising one-square-kilometre landing zone near Mons Mouton in the Moon's south polar region for the Chandrayaan-4 mission. Detailed terrain analysis using high-resolution images has shortlisted the MM-4 area as the safest option for India's first lunar sample return. This site offers gentle slopes, adequate sunlight, and minimal hazards, crucial for the mission's success.

title: Kid Rock defends Turning Point USA halftime show amid Bad Bunny Super Bowl set
content: Kid Rock, the 55 year old Nashville country singer, is gearing up for Turning Point USA's  “All-American Halftime Show”, a direct alternative to Bad Bunny's controversial performance at the Super Bowl LX halftime. While the Grammy winner Bad Bunny has stayed silent about Charlie Kirk's organisation hosting an alternative event, Kid Rock has explained the intent behind doing so for fans.

title: Is the Avengers: Doomsday trailer going to be featured at Super Bowl LX? Here’s what we know
content: Marvel Studios will reportedly skip Super Bowl 2026, ending a 16-year tradition of debuting MCU trailers during the big game. That means fans should not expect new footage from Avengers: Doomsday or other 2026 projects. Rising ad costs and recent teaser releases may have influenced the decision, marking a notable shift in Marvel’s long-standing Super Bowl marketing strategy.

title: Brittany Mahomes reacts to Matthew Stafford’s emotional MVP family tribute
content: Matthew Stafford captured his first AP MVP award after a standout season with the Rams, but it was his family tribute that stole the spotlight. Joined by his four daughters, Stafford became emotional during a touching message calling him a dad first. Brittany Mahomes reacted online, writing, “Okay crying omg,” showing heartfelt support for the moment.

title: Drake Maye’s wife Ann Michael lands big DoorDash deal ahead of Super Bowl 2026
content: Drake Maye’s wife, Ann Michael Hudson, partnered with DoorDash, a $78.6 billion company, ahead of the Patriots’ Super Bowl matchup with the Seahawks. She shared a playful Instagram reel promoting New England cuisine while teasing Seattle. Hudson also posted weekend moments with Maye and friends and recently addressed comparisons to Gisele Bündchen with grace and humor.

title: Super Bowl 2025 vs 2026 attendance: Who drew more fans to the Stadium?
content: Which Super Bowl had more fans? Super Bowl 2025 drew 65,719 at the Superdome while Super Bowl 2026 at Levi's Stadium expects similar attendance of 65,000-70,000. A comparison on how stadium size and location impact live Super Bowl crowds.

title: Why Bad Bunny appears blocked on TikTok ahead of Super Bowl performance
content: TikTok users are confused after finding Bad Bunny’s account blocked without ever searching or following him. Multiple creators shared proof, raising questions about glitches or automatic blocking tools. TikTok has not responded yet, and no official reason has been given. Fans continue to speculate while waiting for clarity from the platform.

title: Rahul Gandhi's message to Gen Z: 'Be flexible and persevere'
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi advised Gen Z to be flexible and persevere, emphasizing that life is not linear. He shared insights from an interaction with NRI students, addressing their anxieties about confidence, judgment, and self-expression. Gandhi highlighted the importance of staying true to oneself amidst societal pressures and labels.

title: Jayalalithaa to EPS: The BJP-AIADMK on-off relationship
content: The BJP and AIADMK have rekindled their alliance for the upcoming Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, marking another chapter in their cyclical relationship of partnership and rupture. Driven by political necessity, the alliance aims to challenge the incumbent Stalin-led DMK government, despite past tensions and strategic divergences between the two parties.

title: PM Modi sets May deadline to prioritise quality improvement of highways
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has set a May deadline for the road transport ministry to prioritize highway quality improvement and develop robust SOPs. This directive follows numerous complaints about poor road conditions, especially post-monsoon. The PM also called for action against underperforming contractors and a study into potential collusion affecting land acquisition delays.

title: Left politics a 'retrograde ideology': PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded BJP MP C Sadanandan Master's courage after he displayed prosthetic legs in Rajya Sabha, highlighting an attack by alleged CPM supporters. Modi criticized "retrograde ideology" for shrinking political ground, while praising Master's presence in Parliament. He also noted Kerala's fatigue with traditional alliances and appreciation for the BJP's vision.

title: Who is Coco Jones? Grammy‑winning singer behind Black anthem at Super Bowl LX
content: Coco Jones performed “Lift Every Voice and Sing” before Super Bowl LX at Levi’s Stadium, drawing both praise and backlash online. While many applauded her powerful vocals, critics questioned the NFL’s continued inclusion of the song, often called the Black national anthem. The league has featured it since 2020 following nationwide protests against racial injustice.

title: Tariff-ied? No more! Exporters look to encash duty advantage
content: Indian exporters, particularly in food and textiles, are cautiously optimistic following a US tariff reduction from 50% to 18%. While some faced significant losses and discounts, the revised trade deal offers a historic opportunity for increased exports and job security. Companies are now focused on rebuilding buyer relationships and exploring new market advantages.

title: T20 WC: Namibia bank on experience of India's World Cup-winning coach
content: Namibia are banking on the experience of 2011 World Cup-winning coach Gary Kirsten as they prepare for their fourth straight T20 World Cup. With Kirsten on board as a consultant, the Gerhard Erasmus-led side has begun preparations in Delhi, focusing on conditions, range-hitting, and adapting to the conditions ahead of their tournament opener against the Netherlands.

title: Trade deal will give new wings to farmers' dreams: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan stated that the India-US interim trade deal will empower farmers, with key agricultural products like major grains, fruits, and dairy remaining secure from US imports. He asserted that the agreement protects farmers' interests and will boost Indian exports, particularly in textiles.

title: Himanta vs Gogoi: Assam politics heats up with CM's explosive 'training in Pak' claim
content: Addressing a press conference ahead of the assembly elections, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma claimed that Gogoi had undertaken a “very confidential visit” to Pakistan in December 2013 and was believed to have undergone “some kind of training” during his 10-day stay. “He stayed there for 10 days. Strangely, Gogoi was digitally silent and no social media post was made. We suspect he went through some kind of training in that period,” the chief minister said.

title: 'Call to genocide': Congress on Himanta's 'point-blank' video; BJP removes post
content: The Congress party has accused the BJP of promoting hate and targeting minorities. This follows a video posted by the BJP's Assam unit showing Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma firing a rifle at two individuals identified as minorities. The Congress has demanded strict judicial action, calling the video a call to genocide.

title: Tom Brady and Alix Earle may be dating quietly as new video surfaces
content: Tom Brady and Alix Earle were spotted dancing together at a Super Bowl party in San Francisco, fueling rumors of a budding romance. The pair, who previously flirted on New Year's Eve and were seen together in St. Barths, appeared inseparable throughout the night. Their continued public appearances suggest a deeper connection beyond a casual encounter.

title: Nayara's future unsure: India may bargain with US for Russian crude
content: US President Trump's threat of a 25% "penalty" on Indian crude imports casts a shadow over the Nayara refinery, majority-owned by Russia's Rosneft. This situation fuels speculation about a change in ownership, as prospective buyers may be deterred by US sanctions.

title: Trade deal a threat to India's interests: CPM
content: CPM and CPI(ML) Liberation have strongly criticized the Indo-US trade deal, alleging the BJP government has made significant concessions detrimental to India's economy, agriculture, and national sovereignty. Both parties demand the deal's details be made public and presented to Parliament, urging the government to halt any agreement harmful to Indian workers and farmers.

title: Electronics output up 6-fold, exports 8-fold in 11 yrs: Govt
content: India's electronics manufacturing has surged six-fold in production and eight-fold in exports over 11 years, making it the world's second-largest mobile phone maker. Driven by the production-linked incentive scheme, mobile production alone saw a more than 100-fold export increase, transforming India into a net exporter.

title: Young J&K MLA draws praise from across the aisle for House speech
content: A young BJP legislator, Devyani Singh Rana, earned cross-party praise for her focused budget speech in the J&K Assembly. She highlighted critical issues like electricity shortages, climate vulnerabilities, and under-spending in education and disaster management, urging for stronger measures. Her pragmatic approach to budgetary concerns resonated with members from all parties.

title: India-US trade deal: Pact puts auto parts exporters in driver's seat
content: India's auto component industry is poised for significant growth following a trade deal with the US, offering preferential tariff treatment and zero-duty access for certain Indian auto parts. This agreement is expected to boost export competitiveness, deepen collaboration, and reinforce India's role in global automotive supply chains, opening new avenues for export-led expansion.

title: In a first for India, a desi aerospace firm gains in-orbit snooping capability, takes images of ISS
content: India's space sector has achieved a significant milestone as Azista Space successfully imaged the International Space Station from its own satellite. This groundbreaking "space watch" capability, demonstrated by the ABA First Runner satellite, marks a first for any Indian company. The feat enhances India's space situational awareness, crucial for protecting national assets in orbit.

title: Celebrities attending Super Bowl 2026: Cardi B, Stefon Diggs, Ben Affleck, and more
content: From Cardi B and Stefon Diggs to Ben Affleck and Taylor Swift, here's the full list of celebrities spotted or confirmed to attend Super Bowl 2026 at Levi’s Stadium. Catch every performance, party, and VIP appearance across the Bay Area this weekend.

title: 'Still 1.25 crore Hindus in Bangladesh': RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat issues unity call
content: ​Bhagwat also spoke about the deepening concerns over the illegal infiltration in the country, which has continued unabated over the decades, saying: "We should inform the police that we suspect these people are foreigners, and they should investigate and keep an eye on them, and we will also keep an eye on them. We will not give employment to any foreigner."

title: Dalal-Steet likely to cheer trade deal progress
content: Dalal Street anticipates a strong opening on Monday as the US-India trade deal nears completion. Positive sentiment is fueled by Gift Nifty's rise and recent constructive developments, including agreement on bilateral trade areas. Analysts foresee increased exports, job creation, and potential foreign investment, boosting market confidence after a volatile week.

title: T20 WC: Sri Lanka's spin web and Kamindu Mendis power 20-run win over Ireland
content: Sri Lanka launched their T20 World Cup campaign with a 20-run victory over Ireland. Kamindu Mendis starred with an unbeaten half-century, guiding Sri Lanka to 163. Ireland faltered in their chase, with spinners Maheesh Theekshana and Wanindu Hasaranga taking three wickets each, restricting the visitors to 143 and securing a dominant win.

title: 'Stay strong': Nadal reacts after Vonn airlifted following horrific crash
content: Rafael Nadal sent support to Lindsey Vonn after her shocking crash in the Winter Olympics downhill event, calling her an inspiration and urging her to stay strong. Vonn was injured just seconds into her run and taken to hospital by helicopter. Teammate Breezy Johnson won gold but expressed concern for Vonn, while her sister called the crash heartbreaking. Vonn had been attempting a comeback despite a ruptured ACL.

title: Placed alongside India and Pak, Namibia captain says there are 'no minnows' in T20
content: Namibia captain Gerhard Erasmus spoke about the challenges of limited exposure, the growth of cricket back home, and why the tag of “Associate” no longer fits in T20 cricket. Namibia will start their campaign against the Netherlands at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi on Tuesday.

title: Salman Khan reacts after Mohan Bhagwat calls him an inspiration for students
content: Salman Khan reacted with a smile after Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat referred to him as an inspiration for college students at a Mumbai event. The moment was captured on camera as Salman, seated in the audience, was seen listening attentively to Bhagwat’s remarks.

title: 'Quad God,' U.S. defend figure skating team gold
content: Ilia Malinin beat Japanese rival Shun Sato in a head-to-head showdown at the Milan Cortina Olympics, helping the U.S. defend its team figure skating gold medal.

title: Sources: 49ers not planning to trade QB Jones
content: The 49ers have no plans to trade quarterback Mac Jones this offseason and fully intend to bring him back as Brock Purdy's backup, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Vonn has leg surgery after crashing at Olympics
content: Lindsey Vonn's bid to win the Winter Olympic downhill ended in a frightening crash that left her with a broken leg.

title: Falcons' Pearce out of jail, facing 5 felony counts
content: Falcons linebacker James Pearce Jr. posted bond Sunday on multiple charges following what police said was a domestic dispute with WNBA player Rickea Jackson.

title: Trump rips Olympian Hess for comments on U.S.
content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday said that it is hard to cheer for American Olympians who are speaking out against administration policies.

title: UNC fined $50K after court storming vs. Duke
content: The ACC fined North Carolina $50,000 on Sunday, the result of the university violating "the league's event security policy" at the end of a chaotic win over rival Duke a night earlier in Chapel Hill.

title: Bucks reach deal with former Nets guard Thomas
content: Cam Thomas, who was waived by the Nets earlier this week, has agreed to a deal with the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Sources: NDSU joins Mtn. West for football in '26
content: FCS powerhouse North Dakota State has finalized an agreement to join the Mountain West Conference in football only starting in 2026, sources told ESPN.

title: 2026 Olympics: Lindsey Vonn crashes, Breezy Johnson wins downhill and U.S. figure skating earns gold
content: The 2026 Milan Cortina Olympics continue. Follow along live with the top highlights from Sunday, which include women's downhill skiing, figure skating's team event and more.

title: Bracketology: Are the No. 1 seeds already locked in?
content: Texas' win over LSU on Thursday makes it tougher for teams such as the Tigers or Vanderbilt to get to a 1-seed.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Iowa's inch to lock status, more results from a packed weekend
content: Iowa, USC pulled out wins but Ohio State, UCF, West Virginia, Tulsa have work to do after a mixed bubble Sunday.

title: Bracketology: Saint Louis could be a real threat come March
content: The Billikens are an analytical unicorn -- and shaping up to be the Atlantic 10's next generational team.

title: Man City's comeback thriller keeps title hopes alive; Liverpool slip further
content: Liverpool looked set to win it, but Man City's two unanswered goals means the Premier League title race stays alive and Liverpool's Champions League hopes are in doubt.

title: Arsenal stun Man City to boost their UWCL hopes and keep WSL title race alive
content: Arsenal's rejuvenated form since the turn of the year continued on Sunday with a 1-0 win over Women's Super League champions-elect Manchester City.

title: Intel from Super Bowl week: Latest on Maxx Crosby, Malik Willis, Jim Schwartz and Sam Darnold
content: Here's what we heard this week in San Francisco on the Super Bowl teams, upcoming free agency, coaching moves and one intriguing trade candidate.

title: 'It's over. Guys are gone': What James Harden and the Clippers realized before the shocking trade
content: The Harden trade was a mutual recognition as much as an admission -- that the 11-time All-Star had a better chance to win elsewhere, and a tumultuous era in LA was effectively over.

title: What NBA insiders are watching amid trade deadline aftermath
content: Tim Bontemps canvases the league after the deadline's grand finale, which now sets up a fascinating summer.

title: America's team: How Cadillac's arrival is already shaking up F1
content: Cadillac is unveiling its first F1 livery in a Super Bowl commercial Sunday night, revealing just how big America's team ambitions are.

title: The best of the 2026 recruiting class, by position
content: How elite are the Nos. 1 and 2 recruits in the 2026 class? We analyze each position and break down who can be sleepers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea and Tottenham vie for Juve's Vlahovic
content: Chelsea and Tottenham have set their sights on Juventus forward Dusan Vlahovic. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: History-sheeter booked for cheating and criminal intimidation
content: As per the police, Ayub Khan, a rowdy-sheeter, lured the victim into a business partnership in 2024, and asked him to invest ₹4.70 lakh

title: Artists perform at weekly cultural programme on Marina Blue Flag beach
content: The Greater Chennai Corporation has been conducting weekly cultural events at the Blue Flag beach since September 21, 2025, with programmes scheduled every Sunday evening

title: Budget may cut reliance on foreign telescopes; trips on space spending
content: Only a few large astronomical observatories are capable of groundbreaking discoveries worldwide, which means researchers have to compete for observation time. When funding agencies favour their own national researchers, international scientists’ access becomes increasingly restricted, and Indians are no exception

title: Rameswaram airport: AAI submits pre-feasibility report, finds site near Keelakarai feasible
content: When compared to the site near Uchipuli, which has a lot of trees, paddy fields, groundwater wells, and residents, the site close to Keelakarai has lesser obstacles and residents as seen from the initial inspection

title: AAP leaders accuse Congress’ Bajwa of making derogatory remark against Punjab Cabinet Minister
content: Congress leaders, however, rejected the charge and accused the AAP of attempting to twist facts and misuse the sensitive issue of Dalits for political mileage by levelling false allegations against Partap Singh Bajwa

title: Missing sub-inspector from U.P.’s Basti found dead in Ayodhya; probe on
content: The deceased was identified as Sub-Inspector Ajay Gaur, who was posted at the Parsarampur police station in Basti district. He had gone missing under suspicious circumstances on February 5

title: Himachal CM Sukhu warns against scrapping Revenue Deficit Grants, urges cross-party appeal to PM
content: The Chief Minister said that already in the post-GST regime, the tax collection growth has come down to around 8%, which was 13% to 14% before the implementation of GST

title: India Stonemart 2026 concludes with call for ecological balance with safe mining
content: Governor Haribhau Bagade stated that Rajasthan excels in stone mining, diversity, and exports, emphasising that ensuring social security in the industry is both a policy issue and a moral responsibility

title: Nearly 3,000 found ineligible to be included on voters’ list in Ernakulam
content: Special Intensive Revision of voter rolls is entering its final phase in the district; most of those found ineligible are deceased; 19,021 persons excluded from voter rolls across the State

title: People against hate: Uttarakhand residents resist rising communal tensions
content: For decades, Uttarakhand was was known more for its pilgrimages and forests than for communal discord. In recent years, however, communal tensions have surfaced repeatedly; However, pushing back, standing firm on coexistence, and rejecting the hate

title: Tirupattur police ask tribal people to surrender country-made firearms
content: Tirupattur Superintendent of Police P. Shymala Devi makes the request to tribal inhabitants of Yelagiri and Jawadhu Hills as part of a special awareness drive on illegal firearms and poaching

title: A year on, demands of surrendered Maoists remain unfulfilled
content: Sluggish rehabilitation process is nothing but betrayal of surrendered Maoists’ trust, says committee

title: In a first, a visually challenged woman all set to become a judge in Kerala
content: Thanya Nathan C. has been ranked first on the merit list of persons with benchmark disabilities in the recently held judicial service examination for the selection of Civil Judges (Junior Division) in the Kerala Judicial Service

title: Police, Excise launch intensive raid in Perumbavoor; nine NDPS cases registered
content: Three migrant women found in lodges without valid documents taken into custody during the drive; police to form committee to address law and order issues involving migrants and local residents

title: Lack of feed affects milk production in T.N.; Karnataka does better
content: According to Basic Animal Husbandry (BAH) statistics, Tamil Nadu has lost area under fodder crops, while Karnataka has improved its coverage

title: PM Modi vows stronger India-Malaysia ties in strategic pivot; says ‘no compromise’ on terrorism
content: The countries sign agreements in key areas, including defence and semiconductors; PM Modi and Malaysian PM highlight efforts to promote trade in local currencies during talks in Kuala Lumpur

title: Namma Metro fare hike put on hold after public backlash; BMRCL to review decision
content: The rollback follows widespread criticism from commuters and a political slugfest, with both the BJP and the Congress attempting to pin responsibility for the proposed hike on the other

title: Islamiah College in Tirupattur inks MOU
content: According to a press release, the agreement signifies a new chapter in strengthening the innovation ecosystem

title: Startup communities launched in two villages in Villupuram district
content: The programme seeks to link startups from Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities with major corporate players, thereby creating wider market access and mentorship opportunities

title: Manipur district issued prohibitory orders over Kuki-Naga tension
content: The Ukhrul District Magistrate has requisitioned the services of the central armed forces to maintain law and order in the Litan area following tension between Naga and Kuki-Zo villagers over an assault case

title: Why is Centre not initiating CBI inquiry against KCR, asks  Revanth Reddy
content: Businessmen were targeted and coerced through surveillance of their phone conversations, which was corroborated by BJP MP Konda Vishweshwar Reddy, Chief Minister said

title: Biotechnology to steer accelerated green growth of the future, say experts
content: At the webinar presented by the Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT), Chennai, and The Hindu, the speakers underlined that biotechnology is the sunrise sector in India, set to accelerate industrial growth, and thus emerges as an impactful career choice

title: Failure to count DNTs in 2027 Census could alienate over 10 crore people: G.N. Devy
content: In an interview with The Hindu, the Chair of the government’s 2006 Technical Advisory Group on DNTs, says the problem of alienating these communities could become much bigger than the problem of enumerating them.

title: Pedalling for a greener tomorrow
content: Around 90 riders, including students and community members, participated in SAKSHAM 2025–26 Cyclothon with an aim to promote fuel conservation and sustainable living. The 13-km ride passed through key city areas before concluding at Shanghumughom.

title: Ailing Kuki-Zo MLA airlifted from Imphal to Delhi
content: Valte, who represents Thanlon Assembly constituency for the BJP, sustained grievous injuries during the May 2023 ethnic violence in Imphal and had been staying in Churachandpur following prolonged treatment in New Delhi

title: Sacrilege at Tirumala will not be tolerated: BJP State chief
content: Madhav flays erstwhile YSRCP regime for hurting Hindu sentiments and says those involved in alleged scam will be dealt with according to law

title: CPI(M) leader Brittas meets Uttarakhand gym owner Deepak, shopkeeper, after alleged right-wing harassment
content: The CPI(M) MP visited Kotdwar on February 8, to express solidarity with gym owner Deepak Kumar, who had stepped in to protect Muslim shopkeeper Vakil Ahmed during an alleged right-wing harassmentprotest over the name of his garment store

title: Police step up action against late night stunts, viral dance gatherings at Hi-Tec City
content: During the weekend special drive, 60 bikes, five cameras and a drone have been seized, and at least four cases have been registered.

title: Each Minister handles his responsibility, says Piyush Goyal on trade deal, Russian oil
content: Piyush Goyal also sought to address the concerns of the farmers unions as well, asserting that “not a single farmer had anything to worry about” as sensitive items have been excluded from the deal

title: March target set for Rajahmundry Airport commissioning
content: The terminal-2 is being built with Rs.350 crore to accommodate 2,100 passengers during the peak hours.

title: Call for tranquilised tiger’s rehabilitation in Andhra landscape grows louder
content: The big cat shouldn’t be confined to a cage any longer as its emotional response and behaviours tend to change due to exposure to ‘human imprint’, observe experts

title: No proposal for districts reorganisation before the government: CM Revanth Reddy
content: He categorically denied claims that the Bhupalpally district was being abolished, asserting that there was no such proposal before the government and added that the BRS was deliberately misleading the public by circulating rumours

title: Bird flu confirmed in two villages of Annamayya district in Andhra Pradesh
content: Department of Animal Husbandry deploys Rapid Response Teams, begins culling operations  in accordance with the Standard Operating Procedures; there is no need to panic, and consumption of properly cooked poultry meat and eggs is safe, it says

title: Moolapet temple to undergo ₹16.7 crore renovation
content: The temple will be readied and thrown open to the devotees in the next 18 months, say Ministers Ponguru Narayana and Anam Ramanarayana Reddy

title: India and Canada agree to shared workplan to guide bilateral cooperation on national security
content: The visit by National Security Advisor Ajit Doval was ahead of Canadian Prime Minister Mike Carney visit to India in March.

title: Kerala University V-C’s chamber vandalism: legal action sought against CPI(M) Syndicate members and SFI activists
content: Kerala University files a complaint with the State Police Chief that CPI(M)-affiliated Syndicate members and SFI activists staged a disruptive protest at the university.

title: Prashant Kishor launches Bihar Navnirman Yatra to rebuild Jan Suraaj
content: Under the Mukhyamantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana, the State Government transferred ₹10,000 each to 1.56 crore women in Bihar in multiple phases, with a major proportion receiving the funds before the polls

title: Defamatory post: CPI State secretary Binoy Viswam lodges complaint with Cyber Cell
content: Post reportedly uploaded by a person from Anchal allege that Viswam’s family members have British citizenship

title: Probe finds no lapses on part of Museum police in handling Maniyanpilla Raju mishap
content: The probe found that the police followed all prescribed procedures, including attempts to contact Maniyanpilla Raju and visit his residence, where neither he nor his car were found.

title: Controversy over election funding of Anto Antony rages
content: After MP admits to borrowing from Nedumparambil Credit Syndicate, his opponent in the 2019 LS poll Veena George asks whether he had disclose the receipt of this fund to the Election Commission.

title: Kerala govt. to launch Digi Kerala 2.0—the second phase of its digital literacy programme
content: This phase will focus on cyber security, AI awareness, training for using the Local Self-Government department’s K-SMART application, and digitisation of basic documents

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan’s dietary preferences become a subject of social media discussion
content: CPI leader C. Divakaran sparks debate by quipping that Pinarayi preferred pricey fish over the day’s common place catch

title: Linguistic, cultural markers could hold the key to caste enumeration method: Professor G.N. Devy
content: The scholar says not taking this opportunity of upcoming Census to separately enumerate Denotified Tribes (formerly ‘criminal’) could alienate more than 10 crore people.

title: India-Greece defence ties in focus as Ministers meet in New Delhi
content: India-Greece defence cooperation, Rajnath Singh-Nikos Dendias meeting, bilateral talks, Joint Services Staff Talks, maritime exercise

title: Bengaluru commuters, drivers push for early rollout of Bharat Taxi
content: The push for Bharat Taxi gained momentum after Amit Shah announced in December 2025 that the government planned to launch the app within ‘one or two months’ to reduce the dependency of commercial vehicle drivers on private companies

title: ‘India-Japan friendship to reach greater heights’: PM Modi congratulates Sanae Takaichi on poll win
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: Air Taxis For Metros, With Roof Tops As Take-Off Landing Pads: CII Looks Ahead
content: A pilot corridor connecting Gurugram, Connaught Place and the Jewar International Airport in Noida can set up an air taxi system that would help the country cut infrastructural bottlenecks and slash transit time from hours to minutes, the CII said.

title: Japanese PM Sanae Takaichi's Party Secures Landslide Victory In Snap Polls
content: The governing party of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi secured a two-thirds supermajority in a key parliamentary election Sunday, Japanese media reported citing preliminary results, earning a landslide victory thanks to her popularity.

title: Madhya Pradesh Man Arrested For Stealing Wheat Worth Rs 100 45 Years Ago
content: After nearly forty-five years on the run, a sixty-five-year-old resident of Madhya Pradesh's Khargone district has been arrested for his role in a theft so modest in value that it might have faded into obscurity for most people.

title: Rekha Gupta Presents Report Card As BJP Completes 1 Year In Delhi
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Sunday presented a report card of Vidhan Sabha, outlining development work worth Rs 250 crore and major projects worth Rs 10,000 crore, as the BJP-led government completed one year in office.

title: NSA Ajit Doval Holds High-Level Talks In Canada, Agrees On Cybersecurity Cooperation
content: India and Canada have agreed to establish security and law-enforcement liaison officers during a meeting with National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval and Nathalie Drouin.

title: Uniform Civil Code Should Be Made Taking Everyone Into Confidence: RSS Chief
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) should be framed by taking everyone into confidence and it should not lead to differences.

title: Plea Questions Mamata Banerjee's Personal Appearance in Supreme Court
content: An application has been filed in the Supreme Court alleging that West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's personal appearance in the top court in the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) matter was "constitutionally improper" and "legally untenable".

title: 5 Dead After Building Collapses In Lebanon's Tripoli: Report
content: The death count in a building collapse in the northern Lebanese city of Tripoli on Sunday rose to five dead, state media reported, as rescuers searched for survivors in the second such incident in weeks.

title: "Trade Negotiation A Two-Way Thing": Amul Chief Allays Farmers' Concerns
content: The India-US trade deal has sparked huge concern among the country's farmers, who feel that cheaper American products coming into the country will add to the challenges they face.

title: UP Businessman's Son Rams Lamborghini Into Pedestrians, Hits Auto, Bike
content: Eyewitnesses said the car first hit an auto-rickshaw and then crashed into a parked Royal Enfield motorcycle, flinging its rider nearly 10 feet into the air.

title: PM Modi Greets Japan PM Sanae Takaichi On Snap Election Victory
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday greeted his Japanese counterpart Sanae Takaichi on her "landmark victory" in the elections to the House of Representatives.

title: 2 EVMs Found In Car In Maharashtra; "Reserve" Devices, Clarifies Poll Body
content: Two Electronic Voting Machines were found in a car near an eatery in Maharashtra's Solapur district, with the State Election Commission on Sunday promising strict action in the matter.

title: Surajkund Fair Sees Increased Footfall Day After Ride Collapse, Cop's Death
content: The tragic events of the previous day, in which a police officer lost his life, did not seem to affect the ongoing Surajkund International Self-Reliant Crafts Mela as the fair witnessed a massive surge on Sunday.

title: 2 Men Chased, Their Car Windows Smashed In Indore; FIR Against BJP Leader
content: A shocking display of street violence unfolded in Indore on Sunday, when a BJP Youth Wing office-bearer, along with his associates, allegedly launched a brutal attack on two young men, leaving them seriously injured and their vehicle vandalised.

title: Rajasthan Honeymoon Murder: They Met 7 Years Ago, Reconnected In 2024, Committed Murder A Year Later
content: What began as a chance meeting seven years ago ended in a brutal crime on January 30, when a newlywed woman allegedly orchestrated the murder of her husband in Rajasthan, just three months after their wedding day.

title: IIT Madras Unveils Rs 600 Crore Venture Capital Fund For Deep Tech Startups
content: In a major push to India's indigenous technology ambitions, the IIT Madras Research Park has launched a Rs 600-crore venture capital fund aimed at nurturing deep tech startups across the country.

title: 'Caste Now Exists For Political Purposes, Selfish Interests': RSS Chief
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said caste now exists largely for selfish interests and political purposes as its traditional occupational basis has disappeared.

title: AAP Leader Detained While Reaching Pit Where Delhi Biker Died
content: The AAP's Delhi unit chief Saurabh Bharadwaj was briefly detained in Janakpuri on Sunday, with police saying the action was taken as he was trying to stage a protest over the death of a biker who fell into a 15-feet deep pit.

title: India, Malaysia Explore AI, Defence Partnership During PM Modi's Visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim held wide-ranging talks in Putrajaya on Sunday aimed at deepening the India-Malaysia Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.

title: CPI(M) MP Meets Hindu Man Who Stood Up For Muslim Shopkeeper Targeted By Mob In Uttarakhand
content: CPI(M) Rajya Sabha MP John Brittas met Deepak Kumar, the Hindu man facing intimidation and backlash after standing up for an elderly Muslim shopkeeper targeted by a communal mob, in Uttarakhand's Kotdwar today.

title: 2026 NFL Honors: Who won the league's biggest awards?
content: the best of the NFL gathered at the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco for Thursday's Super Bowl honors . the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots meet at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California, for super bowl lX . quarterback Matthew Stafford won the biggest prize -- MVP .

title: 'Thank you Benito': Jalen Brunson, J.J. Watt react to Bad Bunny's Super Bowl LX performance on social media
content: Bad Bunny gave fans nearly 13 minutes of energetic entertainment . the Latin trap artist transitioned to "Yo Perreo Sola" in the performance . he brought out Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin as special guest performers .

title: From Josh Howlin to Barker Playfield: NFL-inspired pups headline Puppy Bowl XXII
content: the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots have a roster ready for the spotlight . team Fluff is a terrier-beagle from Nickel City Canine Rescue in Buffalo . she's joined by Barker Playfield, a nod to quarterback Baker Mayfield .

title: Follow live: Darnold finds Barner for 16-yard TD as Seahawks build lead in Super Bowl LX
content: SAN FRANCISCO -- Eleven years after facing off in Super Bowl XLIX, the  Seattle Seahawks  and  New England Patriots  are meeting again with the Lombardi Trophy on the line in Super Bowl LX. Stay tuned here for live updates, highlights and all the action from Levi's Stadium as it unfolds.

title: 📸 Super Bowl LX commercials featuring athletes
content: the ads feature athletes during super Bowl LX between the new England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks . the ads are often priceless, but the right ad can be priceless . there's often a hefty price attached to commercials, and this year is no different .
